attributes.action: Release 'The Russia Report' in to potential Russian interference in UK democracy
attributes.additional_details:
The public paid for this report, and it should be published immediately.

During a BBC Question Time special in the run-up to the election, Mr Johnson said he saw "no reason to interfere in the normal timetable for these things just because there's an election going on".

Dominic Grieve has said the reasons for its non-publication are "entirely bogus".

We're now well past the election, and should not have to tolerate any further excuses or delays.
attributes.background:
The results of the inquiry from the Intelligence Security Committee, begun in November 2017, were passed to Boris Johnson in October 2019.

There is no excuse for delaying its publication any longer.
